name: Accountant
description: AI can automate bookkeeping and tax preparation, but complex financial planning and regulatory interpretation still require human expertise.

name: Customer Service Representative
description: AI chatbots and voice assistants are increasingly capable of handling customer queries, especially for standardized issues. Human reps are still needed for complex or emotionally sensitive interactions.

name: Construction Worker
description: Physical labor, adaptability to changing environments, and safety considerations make this role difficult to automate with current AI and robotics.

name: Data Entry Clerk
description: AI and automation tools can process, extract, and input data far faster and more accurately than humans, making this role highly susceptible to replacement.

name: Graphic Designer
description: AI tools can generate images, logos, and layouts quickly, but lack the nuanced creativity and brand understanding that human designers bring. AI may replace basic design tasks but not high-level creative direction.

name: Software Engineer
description: Currently AI can write code, however it is not always the best code or even correct code, usually a programmer paired with AI can be a more efficient programmer, however at least for now, AI is not a solve of the problem, merely a tool to aid the engineers.

name: Teacher
description: While AI can assist with personalized learning and grading, the human connection, mentorship, and classroom management provided by teachers are difficult to replicate.

name: Truck Driver
description: Autonomous vehicle technology is advancing, but widespread adoption faces regulatory, safety, and infrastructure hurdles. Human drivers remain essential for now, especially in complex or rural environments. Role may over time shift into more of a loading/unloading supervisor as physical labour could one day be also aided by robotics.

name: Lawyer
description: AI can assist with legal research and document review, but legal strategy, courtroom advocacy, and client counseling require human judgment and ethical reasoning.

name: Journalist
description: AI can generate basic news reports and summaries, but investigative journalism, interviews, and nuanced storytelling still rely heavily on human insight.

name: Doctor
description: AI can assist with diagnostics and data analysis, but patient care, ethical decision-making, and surgical precision still require human expertise and accountability.

name: Radiologist
description: AI excels at image recognition and can detect anomalies in scans, but human oversight is crucial for complex cases and final diagnosis.

name: Pharmacist
description: AI can automate prescription dispensing and drug interaction checks, but pharmacists provide essential patient guidance and handle nuanced medical decisions.

name: Retail Cashier
description: Self-checkout systems and AI-powered kiosks are increasingly replacing traditional cashier roles, especially in large retail chains.

name: Chef
description: While AI can assist with recipe generation and robotic cooking, the creativity, presentation, and adaptability of chefs remain uniquely human.

name: Waiter/Waitress
description: Some restaurants use robots or tablets for ordering, but human servers offer personalized service, upselling, and emotional engagement.

name: Financial Analyst
description: AI can analyze market trends and generate reports, but strategic investment decisions and client relationships still rely on human judgment.

name: Musician
description: AI can compose music, but emotional expression, live performance, and cultural relevance are deeply tied to human creativity.

name: Actor
description: AI-generated avatars and deepfakes exist, but authentic performance, improvisation, and emotional depth are uniquely human.

name: Warehouse Worker
description: AI and robotics are increasingly used for inventory management, picking, and packing, reducing the need for manual labor in large-scale operations.

name: Pilot
description: Autopilot systems are advanced, but human pilots are essential for decision-making, emergency response, and passenger reassurance.

name: Flight Attendant
description: Customer service, safety procedures, and emergency response require human presence and empathy.

name: Psychologist
description: AI can offer mental health support tools, but therapeutic relationships, empathy, and complex emotional understanding are human strengths.

name: Human Resources
description: AI can screen resumes and schedule interviews, but conflict resolution, culture building, and employee engagement require human insight.

name: Event Planner
description: AI can assist with logistics and scheduling, but creativity, negotiation, and real-time problem-solving are human-driven.

name: Security Guard
description: AI surveillance systems can monitor environments, but physical presence and judgment in unpredictable situations still require humans.

name: Janitor
description: Robotic cleaning systems exist, but adaptability to different environments and detailed cleaning tasks still favor human workers.

name: Plumber
description: AI cannot easily navigate the physical complexity and variability of plumbing systems. Diagnosis and repair require hands-on expertise.

name: Electrician
description: Electrical work involves safety risks, problem-solving, and physical dexterity that are currently beyond AI capabilities.

name: Fashion Designer
description: AI can generate clothing designs, but trend forecasting, cultural relevance, and artistic vision remain human-led.

name: Biologist
description: AI can assist with data analysis and simulations, but fieldwork, hypothesis generation, and experimental design require human intuition and adaptability.

name: Dentist
description: AI can aid in diagnostics and treatment planning, but dental procedures require precision, dexterity, and patient interaction.

name: Veterinarian
description: AI can help with diagnostics, but animal care, surgery, and emotional support for pet owners require human expertise.

name: Civil Engineer
description: AI can assist with modeling and structural analysis, but on-site decision-making and safety oversight require human involvement.

name: Real Estate Agent
description: AI can match buyers with properties and automate paperwork, but negotiation, local expertise, and client relationships remain human-driven.

name: Barista
description: Automated coffee machines exist, but customer interaction, customization, and caf√© culture still favor human baristas.

name: Bartender
description: Robotic bartenders can mix drinks, but social engagement, improvisation, and hospitality are human strengths.

name: Professional Athlete
description: AI can analyze performance and strategy, but competition, physical skill, and fan engagement are inherently human.

name: Fitness Trainer
description: AI can offer workout plans, but motivation, form correction, and emotional support are best delivered by humans.

name: Mechanic
description: AI can assist with diagnostics, but hands-on repair, improvisation, and customer service still require human skill.

name: Librarian
description: AI can manage cataloging and search systems, but community engagement, curation, and educational support remain human-led.

name: Translator
description: AI translation tools are highly advanced, especially for common languages. Nuance, cultural context, and rare languages still require human translators.

name: Interpreter
description: AI can handle basic live translation, but emotional tone, cultural sensitivity, and real-time adaptation favor human interpreters.

name: Tour Guide
description: AI can provide information, but storytelling, humor, and personal interaction make human guides more engaging.

name: Social Worker
description: AI can assist with case management, but empathy, crisis intervention, and advocacy are deeply human tasks.

name: Politician
description: AI can analyze public opinion and policy impacts, but leadership, persuasion, and democratic representation require human agency.

name: Clergy Member
description: Spiritual guidance, pastoral care, and community leadership are deeply personal and human-centered roles.

name: Professional Gamer
description: AI can play games at superhuman levels, but entertainment value, personality, and fan engagement keep human players relevant.

name: Video Editor
description: AI can automate basic editing, transitions, and even generate highlight reels, but storytelling, pacing, and creative direction still require human input.

name: Film Director
description: AI can assist with shot planning and script analysis, but vision, leadership, and emotional storytelling are uniquely human.

name: Animator
description: AI can generate animations and character movements, but artistic style, timing, and emotional nuance still rely on human creativity.

name: Sound Engineer
description: AI can mix and master audio tracks, but live sound management and creative mixing decisions require human expertise.

name: Voice Actor
description: AI-generated voices are increasingly realistic and customizable, posing a significant risk to voice acting in commercial and entertainment sectors.

name: Logistics Coordinator
description: AI can optimize routes, inventory, and schedules, but handling disruptions and coordinating across teams still benefits from human oversight.

name: Supply Chain Analyst
description: AI excels at predictive analytics and optimization, but strategic planning and vendor relationships require human judgment.

name: Farmer
description: AI and robotics can automate planting, harvesting, and monitoring, but land management, decision-making, and adaptability remain human-led.

name: Park Ranger
description: AI can assist with monitoring wildlife and visitor data, but conservation, education, and emergency response require human presence.

name: Firefighter
description: AI can assist with hazard prediction and robotics, but physical rescue, decision-making under pressure, and teamwork are human strengths.

name: Police Officer
description: AI can support surveillance and data analysis, but law enforcement, community engagement, and judgment in dynamic situations require humans.

name: Paramedic
description: AI can assist with triage and diagnostics, but emergency care, physical intervention, and emotional support are human-driven.

name: Judge
description: AI can analyze legal precedents, but ethical reasoning, interpretation, and societal judgment are inherently human responsibilities.

name: Receptionist
description: AI-powered virtual assistants can handle scheduling, calls, and basic inquiries, reducing the need for human receptionists in many settings.

name: Proofreader
description: AI tools can detect grammar, spelling, and style issues with high accuracy, making this role highly automatable.

name: Copywriter
description: AI can generate marketing copy and product descriptions, but brand voice, persuasion, and originality still benefit from human creativity.

name: UX Designer
description: AI can analyze user behavior and suggest interface improvements, but empathy, intuition, and user testing remain human-led.

name: Web Developer
description: AI can generate websites and code snippets, but customization, debugging, and integration still require human oversight.

name: IT Support Specialist
description: AI can troubleshoot common issues and guide users through solutions, reducing demand for basic tech support roles.

name: Ethicist
description: AI can simulate ethical scenarios, but moral reasoning, cultural sensitivity, and philosophical debate are deeply human.

name: Research Scientist
description: AI can accelerate data analysis and simulations, but hypothesis generation, experimentation, and interpretation are human-driven.

name: Lab Technician
description: AI and robotics can automate many lab procedures, but troubleshooting, sample handling, and safety oversight still need humans.

name: Hotel Manager
description: AI can optimize bookings and customer service, but hospitality, crisis management, and team leadership remain human-led.

name: Carpenter
description: AI can assist with design and measurements, but craftsmanship, material handling, and on-site decisions are human-driven.

name: Architect
description: AI can generate design concepts and optimize structures, but creativity, client collaboration, and aesthetics are human-led.

name: Interior Designer
description: AI can suggest layouts and styles, but taste, personalization, and emotional resonance are human strengths.

name: Makeup Artist
description: AI can simulate looks and offer tutorials, but application, customization, and client rapport are human-driven.

name: Hairdresser
description: AI can recommend styles and techniques, but cutting, styling, and personal interaction require human skill.

name: Soldier
description: AI can assist with surveillance, targeting, and logistics, but physical presence, decision-making under fire, and moral judgment remain human responsibilities.

name: Drone Operator
description: AI can automate flight paths and targeting, but oversight, ethical decisions, and mission coordination still require human control.

name: Military Strategist
description: AI can simulate scenarios and analyze data, but geopolitical insight, creativity, and psychological understanding are human strengths.

name: Cybersecurity Analyst
description: AI can detect and respond to threats rapidly, but complex threat analysis and adaptive defense strategies require human expertise.

name: Intelligence Analyst
description: AI can process vast data sets and identify patterns, but context, cultural nuance, and strategic interpretation remain human-led.

name: Weapons Technician
description: AI can assist with diagnostics and maintenance schedules, but hands-on repair and safety checks require human skill.

name: Combat Medic
description: AI can assist with triage and diagnostics, but emergency care, field improvisation, and emotional support are human-driven.

name: Military Pilot
description: AI can support navigation and targeting, and autonomous drones are advancing, but complex missions and aerial combat still rely on human pilots.

name: Naval Officer
description: AI can aid in navigation and threat detection, but leadership, tactical decisions, and crew management are human-led.

name: Defense Policy Advisor
description: AI can model outcomes and analyze data, but diplomacy, ethics, and strategic foresight are human strengths.

name: Military Engineer
description: AI can assist with design and logistics, but field adaptability, innovation, and safety oversight require human input.

name: Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Specialist
description: AI and robotics can assist with bomb disposal, but judgment, adaptability, and risk assessment remain human-led.

name: Signals Intelligence Officer
description: AI can intercept and decode signals, but interpretation, context, and strategic relevance require human analysis.

name: Military Trainer
description: AI can simulate scenarios and track performance, but mentorship, discipline, and leadership development are human strengths.

name: Defense Contractor
description: AI can streamline manufacturing and logistics, but innovation, compliance, and client relations still require human oversight.

name: Tattoo Artist
description: Tattoo artists create permanent body art using specialized tools and techniques. The role requires creativity, manual dexterity, and close client interaction.
ai_impact: AI may assist with design generation, but cannot replicate the precision, trust, and physical artistry required for tattooing.

name: City Planner
description: City planners develop land use plans and programs to help communities grow sustainably. They analyze data, consult stakeholders, and balance environmental, economic, and social factors.
ai_impact: AI can support data analysis and simulation modeling, but human judgment is essential for ethical and community-based decisions.

name: Prompt Engineer
description: Prompt engineers craft effective inputs for AI systems to optimize outputs. They understand model behavior and fine-tune prompts for accuracy and relevance.
ai_impact: This role exists because of AI and is unlikely to be automated soon, though tools may simplify prompt creation.

name: Synthetic Data Specialist
description: Synthetic data specialists generate artificial datasets to train machine learning models while preserving privacy and diversity.
ai_impact: AI tools can assist in generation, but human oversight is needed to ensure quality, relevance, and ethical use.
